hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: New Look For Asylum System

abstract.p: Britain plans radical reform of asylum system; will issue identification cards with photographs and fingerprints to asylum seekers and house them in reception centers, paying for their room and board and giving them spending money to replace current vouchers (S)

block.p: The government announced plans for a ''radical and fundamental reform'' of the asylum system, which has been widely criticized as unfair both to people seeking asylum and to the communities that house them. The government plans to issue identification cards with photographs and fingerprints to asylum seekers and house them in reception centers, paying for their room and board and giving them spending money to replace the current vouchers. More than 100,000 people sought asylum last year.
